snippet: The Securities and Exchange Commission’s new policy on requiring some defendants to admit misconduct when settling cases will make will make pursuing the big fish draining for the agency, the author writes.
abstract: The Securities and Exchange Commission’s new policy on requiring some defendants to admit misconduct when settling cases will make will make pursuing the big fish draining for the agency, the author writes.

headline.main: Requiring Defendants to Admit Guilt Will Be Costly for S.E.C.
